title: Manifest
description: The manifest contains the basic information to register the pack into Minecraft.

format_version.title: Format Version
format_version.description: This defines the current version of the manifest. Don't change this unless you have a good reason to.

header.title: Header
header.description: This is the heading of the manifest and is required for the manifest to be valid.

name.description: This is the name of the pack as it appears within Minecraft. This is a required field.

description.description: This is a short description of the pack. It will appear in the game below the name of the pack.

uuid.description: This is a special type of identifier that uniquely identifies this pack from any other pack.

version.description: This is the version of your pack in the format [majorVersion, minorVersion, revision].

min_engine_version.description: This is the minimum version of the game that this pack was written for.

base_game_version.description: This is the version of the base game your world template requires.

lock_template_options.description: This option is required for any world templates. This will lock the player from modifying the options of the world.

dependencies.description: Defines the dependencies of the pack

anyOf.description: Minecraft native module - needed to use the 'Minecraft' module.
GameTest native module - needed to use the 'GameTest' module.

uuid.description: This is the unique identifier of the pack that this pack depends on. It needs to be the exact same UUID that the pack has defined in the header section of it's manifest file.

version.description: This is the specific version of the pack that your pack depends on. Should match the version the other pack has in its manifest file.

authors.description: Name of the author(s) of the pack.

url.description: The home website of your pack.

capabilities.description: These are the different features that the pack makes use of that aren't necessarily enabled by default.

oneOf.description: Allows HTML files in the pack to be used for custom UI, and scripts in the pack to call and manipulate custom UI.
Allows the pack to add, change or replace Chemistry functionality.
Allows the pack to use ray tracing features.

folder_name.description: The name of the folder that this subpack references.

name.description: The name of the subpack shown in game.

memory_tier.description: This number specifies the order subpacks in game.
